p: The findings achieved in this study provide evidence that Tmsb w, the aqueous extract from the stem bark of T. mantaly, is relatively safe and highly potent on P. berghei-infected mice and thereby validate the use of T. mantaly in folk medicine to treat malaria and related symptoms. However, Tmsb w should be further investigated to isolate and characterize its bioactive principle to feed antimalarial drug discovery pipeline.
